The Rite is complete. The Marks of the Grail are upon me. The First Mark is what I have said, and the second is what I have done. If I inspect my body, I'll find the Third. I thrill with new appetites.
I've gone as far as I can in dream. I must perform the Work. But perhaps, when I consider my desires, it's not usually men that come to mind...
Tastes alter, desires change, thoughts bend to other forms.

Tastes alter, desires change, thoughts bend to other forms.
This rite is the Key that will allow the Watchman's gaze to enter me. I will be changed forever.

The Rite is complete. The Marks of the Watchman are upon me. The First Mark is what I have said, and the second is what I have done. If I inspect my body, I'll find the Third. My hungers have been refined, now.
[This text is available when advanced legacies arrive.]
Remember that the ending text will contain the payload.

I have been in the flame so many times. The plates of my flesh grate one against another. I conjure now the heat of the Forge, which will sear from me what I was. I will die as I pass the Tricuspid Gate, but death is not the end. I will be immortal: a Long, favoured of the Forge.
I am becoming a name of fire. Remember that the ending text will contain the payload.
[This text is available when advanced legacies arrive.]
The Feast is beginning. Remember that the ending text will contain the payload.
The Feast of the True Birth

I am swollen with the lives of others. The seams of my body begin to rupture. Now I invoke the Red Grail, who is the Mother of Mountains, who Consumes, who is the Source. In Her Name I will give birth to myself. The Tricuspid Gate opens. I will be immortal: a Long, favoured of the Grail.
[This text is available when advanced legacies arrive.]
I am approaching the Glory. Remember that the ending text will contain the payload.

Little of this flesh remains. I will pass through the Tricuspid Gate and I will not return. The Watchman awaits me. In His footsteps, I will find the Glory's light. The understanding is too much for my soul to hold, and so my soul will open. I will not be immortal: I will be more than that.
As yet, I have only the needs and desires of any other mortal. But what stirs in me?
I am never quite warm enough, now.
I have dreamed of the Forge, and I long for the heat of her flames. It is almost time to perform the Work and begin the changes - but I must have enough Forge-aspect. Exploration might find more.
Even in waking hours, I have begun to see new colours.
My curiosity is becoming a physical need. My eyes will be thresholds. It is almost time to perform the Work and begin the changes - but I must have enough Lantern-aspect. Exploration might find more.
The Grail's wonderful tides move in me. It is almost time to perform the Work and begin the changes - but I must have enough Grail-aspect. Exploration might find more.
The Grail has touched me with her wonderful fingers. It is almost time to perform the Work and begin the changes - but I must have enough Grail-aspect. Exploration might find more.
Hunger burns in my heart - hunger for the power the invisible arts might bring.
The Forge of Days waits in my dreams. If I learn the Forge's lore, and I dream of this temptation, I can advance my purpose. The need gnaws at me.
Hunger glows in my brain - hunger for the knowledge the invisible arts might bring.
The Watchman, who is the Door-in-the-Eye, waits in my dreams. If I learn the Lantern-lore, and I dream of this temptation, I can advance my purpose. The need gnaws at me.
Hungers roam my body - hungers for the pleasures that the invisible arts might bring.
The red cup, the cup of drowning and devouring, waits in my dreams. If I learn the Grail-lore, and I dream of this temptation, I can advance my purpose. The need gnaws at me.
I require ever hotter fires. Their fuel now is rare and costly. If I cannot afford them, the cold will overtake me.
I am shivering. Without the fire, my flesh will thin and weaken.
My strength is less. My blood is colder. I think that even some of my scars are healing. I diminish.
The flames yearn for me as I for them. Their touch is much more than pain. I have another Mark.
The recently dead, or the living.
A thirst for blood? If only it were so simple. I will drain them far more deeply.
Without the life of others, my own life will feed on itself.
My fluids thin; my flesh dessicates; my changes uncoil; my passions dim. I am becoming less than I want.
When I am done, the satisfaction is deep as the moon in the sea. Another Mark buds in me.
The last words of a living mind.
Time alone in a quiet room with a living mind. That's all I need.
If I cannot consume the thoughts of a living mind, my need will turn in upon itself.
The Light of the Mansus dims in me. I am less than I was. I need conversation. I must have those particular conversations.
I have drunk the light of their mind. It thrills and fills me. The Marks brighten in me.
